metadata.title: CVE-2017-5471 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 53. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort thatsome of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 54.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '54.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
